newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy cuts discount rate to 6.75 pct from 7.50 pct.
newsitem.headline: Italy cuts discount rate to 6.75 pct from 7.50 pct.

text.p: The Bank of Italy said on Tuesday it would cut the official discount rate to 6.75 percent from 7.50 percent.
The cut will take effect on Wednesday, a Bank of Italy statement said. The last change to the discount rate was on Oct 23, when it was reduced by 75 basis points.
The Bank's fixed term advances, or Lombard rate, was simultaneously cut to 8.25 percent from a previous 9.00 percent.
A bank statement said that inflation had remained on moderated levels over the past few months, in line with objectives set for the current year.
Preliminary data from Italian cities released earlier on Tuesday showed that inflation for January was expected to remain steady at 2.6 percent, according to analysts.
